name: Grand Hyatt Taipei

reviews.text: We had a good experience (and have rated it accordingly), but were let down by a promise of luxury and style of the Grand Hyatt brand that we never enjoyed but most certainly paid for.
reviews.title: Know What You'll Get:Dated Interior and Poor Value

likes.liked: — Fantastic staff who were always standing ready to assist
likes.disliked: — Very poor value: the accommodation doesn't live up to the promise of the brand.

reviews.text: This was to be our ’touch of luxury’ during our holiday. Despite requesting a higher level room, we were placed on the bottom floor, facing a wall with a view of the air conditioning units. A glimpse of Taipei 101 was possible by straining your neck.
reviews.title: Very classy beautiful hotel, not sure about the location

likes.disliked: — Nothing in particular. Not near the trains.

reviews.text: The room, while very clean and well maintained, was tired and dated. I read (somewhere) that the hotel is undergoing a renovation, but our floor clearly had yet to be done. A nasty surprise was the charge for Internet access, which was outrageously expensive and according to the staff, is never included in the room rate.
reviews.title: Good Hotel
It was nice.. but you need to know this
reviews.text: The room/value equation aside, the hotel is well located for shopping, taxi's are plentiful and the staff were generally excellent: friendly, helpful and speak good English. We were disappointed that the reputation for luxury that we paid extra for wasn’t part of our experience.
TIP: In order to avoid the hideously expensive Internet charges, use the coffee shops in Taipei 101: access is free and fast and is only 5 mins walk from the hotel.
reviews.title: Reasonably priced deluxe hotel

likes.liked: — Excellent dining choices within the hotel

reviews.text: Location is excellent, hotel is gorgeous, attached to 101, tallest bldg. and a mall, with lots of high end stores/resturants and even a normal food court. tons of resturants abound in the hotel and nearby. safe neighborhood to walk around. My flt was canceled due to the typhoon and I'm happy i'm here. plenty to do. hotel does also have 110 voltage in rooms, free internet and breakfast with my rate. breakfast is unbelievable. delicious.
reviews.title: Couldn't have been stuck in a better hotel during the typhoon

likes.disliked: — spa - outdated, had to balance my foot on the nail tech's knee

reviews.title: Welcome relief! Great hotel!
reviews.text: the only bad thing is their spa. stay away from this antiquicated hole in the wall.
LOVED my stay here. I checked out of a dive of a hotel after one night and came here, and it was a welcome relief!
reviews.title: The Absolute Best Hotel Ever!!!!

reviews.text: The room was spcious, clean and had everything I needed. The buffest breakfast is extensive, and not as much as some other hotels.($23AU)
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

likes.disliked: — Prices of food, drinks, and internet access

reviews.text: The staff are friendly and always willing to help. And the location is great. Right next door to Taipei 101, and only 5 mins taxi from the city centre.
reviews.title: Convenient, Courteous, Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel rooms are functional but very old and in need of repair. When we first checked into our room on the 22nd floor (grand club level), our TV and toilet were both broken. The hotel sent someone to fix both immediately, but it was a little annoying. The ceiling is very low which makes the room feel like a small box. The really disgusting thing were the carpets. There were several noticeable stains on the carpet, so I wore slippers or shoes whenever I walked around.
reviews.title: A little rundown but good service and good location

reviews.text: The grand club level has free breakfast and cocktails and snacks from 5pm-8pm everyday. There are receptionists who sit in the hallway outside the lounge area on each grand club level who are very helpful. The service is good and people are very friendly. If the hotel were in better shape, I would recommend this place. It seems though that Taipei doesn't have very many nice hotel options.
reviews.title: first trip to taipei

reviews.text: rooms can suffer noise coming from under the door. we moved rooms but it was no probs as the staff were helpful and it is not the hotel's fault that some guests can be noisey.
reviews.title: Great Reliable Hotel

reviews.text: pool area was very nice considering it is in the middle of a huge city.
reviews.title: I can hear foot steps!

reviews.text: across the street isa huge shopping mall with many restaurant options
reviews.title: Pretentious lobby; nice, but shabby hotel; excellent staff

likes.disliked: — Rooms are a bit faded and worn

reviews.text: As many other reviewers have noted, the Grand Hyatt is in a fabulous location with amazingly attentive staff. The hospitality here is second to none and the rooms are large and clean--with plenty of amenities. I was there on business and found it to be extremely conducive to getting things done--but still enjoying the surroundings. The pool is great--although don't order room service unless you have lots of time--i think they have to run up 40 floors to get it for you :)
reviews.title: Pretty Grand

reviews.text: My only caveats are that it is a HUGE hotel and quite bustling. If you are looking for something with some charm or solitude, this is not the place.
reviews.title: Unbeatable location and service

likes.liked: — Great food, comfortable rooms, and excellent service.

reviews.text: I stayed in a grand club room on the 25th floor facing the Taipei 101 building. The room had a separate setting area with a desk and two chairs separated by a partition with a complementary mini-bar. After an overnight transpacific flight and arriving early in the morning. The hotel staff were extremely helpful by allowing me to an early check-in so I can retire to my room to rest and do some work. I was enjoying the view from my room of the Taipei 101 building until the suite next door began an early evening dance party. With no other comparable room available as the hotel was sold out. I was relocated to a corner suite on the 15th floor on the other side of the building.
reviews.title: Great Place

likes.liked: — New building and a good location

reviews.text: The Grand Club staff were extremely courteous and went out of their way to make sure that my personal items were transferred from one room to the other as smoothly as possible. Maya, the Grand Club Manager, also made sure that all my needs were met and that the remaining of my stay at this hotel was as comfortable as it can be. The corner suite I stayed on the 15th floor was more spacious and even more comfortable than the club room I had on the 25th floor, with a greater panoramic view of the East side of the city and a beautiful view of the swimming pool below. The breakfast selection at the Grand Club Lounge was also excellent with different variety of Asian and Western delicacies. The only thing that beats the food at the Grand Club Lounge was the exceptional service I received at this hotel.
reviews.title: Good hotel, even better with an upgrade

likes.liked: — Location... and the free champagne in the minibar

reviews.text: During my stay at this property, I also used the fitness room on a couple of occasions. I like the fact that the fitness center is open 24 hours a day for people like me who travel from overseas and wakes up at 4 or 5 in the morning and wanting to workout. But due to renovation, the fitness room I used was temporary and only mediocre in terms of its layout and equipments. I chose this hotel for my brief business stay in Taipei because of its great location and it being one of American Express’s Fine Resort and Hotel Program properties. I would recommend this property to anyone staying in Taipei for business or pleasure. I regularly stay at properties from American Express’s Fine Resort and Hotel Programs, including the Ritz-Carlton and Four Seasons properties, but this hotel is truly one of the best properties in the Fine Resort and Hotel Program. I will stay there again next time when I’m in Taipei.
reviews.title: Impeccable location

reviews.text: Very clean and spacious. This is an excellent hotel for American tourists looking for comfortable surroundings in a foreign land. The breakfast buffet is nothing short of incredible. The staff is very helpful - they linked us up with a great tour guide for a tour of Taipei.
reviews.title: Best breakfast in Taipei!

reviews.text: If you are interested in shopping, the hotel seems to be located in a very good spot. The rooms are comparable to the other Hyatt hotels around the world with a fairly large bathroom. I have stayed at this hotel on two separate occasions, and found each time that carpet had lots of stains on it. The linens, towels and bathrobes provided were always very clean. The hotel has a very nice pool (large enough to do laps), and a fitness center. The staff at the front desk is generally helpful.
reviews.title: Nice size room and nice location, but not the cleanest hotel for the price

reviews.text: The following comments are based on my business stay of five days. I found the lower-level staff to be helpful and efficient, but the management unhelpful in resolving issues (see below). The physical characteristics of the hotel were appealing, though a bit dated. In general, the public areas are well maintained and attractive. My room (9th floor near the elevators) was nicely outfitted, but in need of renovation. The worst manifestation of the aging infrastructure was backup of sewer gas into the bathroom, at times creating a stench to rival any outhouse or port-a-john I've ever experienced. The hotel was allegedly full during my stay, so the management was not able to move me to another room based on this problem (and in fact seemed essentially unconcerned about the problem). On the plus side, the gym is modern, clean, and pretty well equipped with both aerobic and weight equipment. There is a lot, from elegant Taipei 101 to streets lined with mom-and-pop shops, within easy walking distance of this hotel. The per-night room rate I was charged at check-out substantially exceeded the rate I reserved through the Hyatt website. Again, the management was unsympathetic, even when shown the reservation confirmation printout from the Hyatt site. Their position was that this rate agreement was not binding on them.
reviews.title: Generally nice, but odoriferous...

reviews.text: the location of this Hotel is absolutely ideal & it is right in front of Taipei 101, the 5th hightest building in the world. Its a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Loved Taipei & Hyatt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location for shopping. It's about 10 mins walk to Shin Kong Mitsukoshi (Japanese departmental store) which has 4 stores adjacent to each other. One of them (A4 building) is entirely devoted to females, although guys might be interested in Tokyu Hands (Japanese store selling beauty products and household goods) located on the 5th floor. Taipei 101 is just 5 mins walk away.
reviews.title: Good location, not a bad choice

reviews.text: It's a good 10 walk to the Taipei City Hall MRT station. Taxis are reasonably priced so I would suggest using the taxi to get around the city if you are only there for a few days and don't want to waste time travelling. Fares start at TWD 70 and it goes up by TWD 5 (each additional 300m).
reviews.title: Stayed here on a business trip

reviews.text: I have travelled to Taipei on business every month for the last 7 years. During this entire time, I have managed to avoid staying at the Grand Hyatt (opting instead for the Far Eastern, Sherwood or Regent) due to very persistent rumors that it is haunted.
reviews.title: Prbably not haunted, but definitely run down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last week, I ended up at the Grand Hyatt because all of my "usual" hotels were either full or only available at incredibly inflated prices. My conclusion -- this hotel probably isn't haunted, but avoid it anyway because its rooms are sorely in need of renovation. Rooms are dark, have very low ceilings and are not well designed (for example, the minibar is hidden in a closet like structure that I didn't even realize was there until about an hour before I checked out). The bathroom, tv, etc. all look at least 10 years old. The Far Eastern and Sherwood are also getting run down, but they are still a heck of a lot better than the Hyatt. The rooms in the Regent, which was renovated a few years ago, are a step above the ones in all of these places....
reviews.title: Utterly Dissapointing
Another great HYATT stay
reviews.text: The gym is in the middle of renovations, so there is a temporary gym in what appears to a space converted from a bunch of former guest rooms -- not sure when the new gym will be completed, but the current one is certainly not ideal due to very low ceilings, limited equipment selection, etc....There are also no changing rooms, no lockers and no steam rooms until the renovations are done.

The public areas of the Grand Hyatt are very nice, and in the "typical" style of a Grand Hyatt. The location of the hotel is also terrific, being just steps away from 101 and lots of restaurants, shopping, movie theatres, etc.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: If you are not superstitious and merely need a place to sleep, the Taipei Grand Hyatt will do. However, the rooms in this hotel are not of the caliber that I have come to expect from Grand Hyatt and I would only stay here if there were no other hotels of this class available in town.
reviews.title: great hotel for first time American traveler to Taipei

likes.disliked: — not enough light, charge for internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I decided to stay at the Grand Hyatt because we were visiting Taipei for only a long weekend. The hotel's close to the Taipei 101 skyscraper and there are lots of shops and eateries nearby. Since my wife's superstitious, I was somewhat surprised that she said nothing when our room turned out to be room 1444 (unlucky numbers for Chinese people!). A day later, our Taipei friends told us that the hotel's known to be haunted, especially the 14th floor. Some years ago, when inflight attendants used to stay in the hotel, they all avoided that corner of the hotel, but we had no problems. I believe the hotel was built on a site where Japanese soldiers used to execute Taiwanese during WWII. In any case, our window view was of the Taipei 101 tower, an amazing view. Just across the street, the 101 has a shopping arcade in the lower floors, lots of brand names, and a Page One mega bookstore. Also nearby: the New York New York shopping center, the Japanese Mitsukoshi department store spread out over several buildings, a dozen cinemas, Eslite bookstore (several floors of books), etc. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, as there are plenty of restaurants, Asian and Western nearby. The Mister Donut, a Japanese franchise, was just a few minutes by foot. I should note that the hotel was okay, facilities and service. Check-in and check-out were fast and efficient, but no bell boys came to assist us with our luggage (there were no bell boys to be found, I think). There are two entrances to the hotel: the main, where cars drop off people, and the side entrance, where airport buses stop; maybe the bell boys are only found at the main entrance? I think the hotel was built in the early eighties and it shows. The lobby is luxurious but a few upgrades should be in order. We left a long list of remarks and comments with the manager and he seemed to acknowledge some of the problems, but nothing more...
reviews.title: Not Grand enough

likes.liked: — Luxury hotel in a great location
likes.disliked: — Showing its age, needs some cosmetic upgrading

reviews.text: when I told my coworkers I was staying here, they all gave me various reasons not to, ie it's too old, stay at one of the smaller cooler newer boutique hotels,
reviews.title: an oasis in Taipei

likes.disliked: — the lighting in my room was on the dark side

reviews.text: or
reviews.title: One of the best business hotels anywhere

reviews.text: it's haunted they told me, stay some place less haunted
reviews.title: Don't Miss The Breakfast Buffet!

reviews.text: but I already made the booking and I could not be bothered to change, and thankfully at the end, no regrets
reviews.title: Loved the Grand Hyatt

likes.disliked: — One pays extra for internet access--at this base price it should be part of the package!

description: Situated in the heart of Taipei’s dynamic business and entertainment area - Hsin Yi district, the hotel is conveniently located within the World Trade Centre complex and adjacent to Taipei 101 skyscraper. The hotel is 20 minutes by car to Taipei World Trade Centre Nankang Exhibition Hall and only 45 minutes from Taoyuan International Airport.
